isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Crankcase, Crankshaft, Connecting Rods, And Pistons - Crankcase Reconditioning - Check Crankcase Surface for Flatness

caution.para: The threads in the crankcase bolt holes must be cleaned and blown dry with filtered compressed air. Dirt or oil left in the holes may cause binding or a false torque reading during reassembly.
Do not resurface the crankcase. Surface defects beyond those listed are not correctable. To avoid engine damage, replace the crankcase.

step1.para: After cleaning, inspect the crankcase for scoring, roughness, cracking or wear at the cylinder bores.

figure.caption: Checking the Crankcase Deck for Flatness

step1.para: Using a straightedge, check the top surface of the crankcase for flatness by attempting to insert a 0.10 mm (0.004 in) feeler gauge between the straightedge and the crankcase head surface. If the gap exceeds 0.10 mm (0.004 in), the crankcase must be replaced.
